property.name: wms.tmp.dir
property.description: Temporary directory on the local filesystem. Change this setting to point to a location more permanent than '/tmp' (The '/tmp' directory is often cleared on machine restart).

property.name: wms.local.dir
property.description: Directory on the local filesystem to be used as a local storage.

property.name: wms.master.info.port
property.description: The port for the WMS Master web UI. Set to -1 if you do not want a UI instance run.

property.name: wms.master.info.bindAddress
property.description: The bind address for the Wms Master web UI

property.name: wms.client.pause
property.description: General client pause value. Used mostly as value to wait before running a retry of a failed get, region lookup, etc.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a ZooKeeper server should report its IP address.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a ZooKeeper server should use to determine the host name used by the master for communication and display purposes.

property.name: wms.master.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a master should report its IP address.

property.name: wms.master.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a master should use to determine the host name used for communication and display purposes.

property.name: wms.server.info.port
property.description: The port for the WmsServer web UI Set to -1 if you do not want the server UI to run.

property.name: wms.server.info.port.auto
property.description: Whether or not the WmsServer UI should search for a port to bind to. Enables automatic port search if wms.server.info.port.auto is already in use. Useful for testing, turned off by default.

property.name: wms.server.thread.wakefrequency
property.description: Time to sleep in between searches for work (in milliseconds). Used as sleep interval by service threads such as log roller.

property.name: wms.server.versionfile.writeattempts
property.description: How many time to retry attempting to write a version file before just aborting. Each attempt is seperated by the wms.server.thread.wakefrequency milliseconds.

property.name: wms.hash.type
property.description: The hashing algorithm for use in HashFunction. Two values are supported now: murmur (MurmurHash) and jenkins (JenkinsHash). Used by bloom filters.

property.name: zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout. WMS passes this to the ZooKeeper quorum as suggested maximum time for a session (This setting becomes zookeeper's 'maxSessionTimeout'). See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/current/zookeeperProgrammers.html#ch_zkSessions "The client sends a requested timeout, the server responds with the timeout that it can give the client. " In milliseconds.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.parent
property.description: Root Znode for WMS in ZooKeeper. All of Wms's ZooKeeper znodes that are configured with a relative path will go under this node. By default, all of Wms's ZooKeeper file path are configured with a relative path, so they will all go under this directory unless changed.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.rootserver
property.description: Path to ZNode holding root region location. This is written by the master and read by clients and region servers. If a relative path is given, the parent folder will be ${zookeeper.znode.parent}. By default, this means the root location is stored at /wms/root-region-server.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.acl.parent
property.description: Root ZNode for access control lists.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper Quorum. For example, "host1.mydomain.com,host2.mydomain.com,host3.mydomain.com". By default this is set to localhost for local and pseudo-distributed modes of operation. For a fully-distributed setup, this should be set to a full list of ZooKeeper quorum servers. If WMS_MANAGES_ZK is set in wms-env.sh this is the list of servers which we will start/stop ZooKeeper on.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.peerport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper peers to talk to each other. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.leaderport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper for leader election. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.useMulti
property.description: Instructs Wms to make use of ZooKeeper's multi-update functionality. This allows certain ZooKeeper operations to complete more quickly and prevents some issues with rare ZooKeeper failure scenarios (see the release note of HBASE-6710 for an example). IMPORTANT: only set this to true if all ZooKeeper servers in the cluster are on version 3.4+ and will not be downgraded. ZooKeeper versions before 3.4 do not support multi-update and will not fail gracefully if multi-update is invoked (see ZOOKEEPER-1495).

property.name: wms.zookeeper.property.initLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that the initial synchronization phase can take.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.property.syncLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that can pass between sending a request and getting an acknowledgment.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.property.dataDir
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The directory where the snapshot is stored.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.property.clientPort
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The port at which the clients will connect.

property.name: wms.zookeeper.property.maxClientCnxns
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. Limit on number of concurrent connections (at the socket level) that a single client, identified by IP address, may make to a single member of the ZooKeeper ensemble. Set high to avoid zk connection issues running standalone and pseudo-distributed.

property.name: wms.rest.port
property.description: The port for the WMS REST server.

property.name: wms.rest.readonly
property.description: Defines the mode the REST server will be started in. Possible values are: false: All HTTP methods are permitted - GET/PUT/POST/DELETE. true: Only the GET method is permitted.

property.name: wms.rest.threads.max
property.description: The maximum number of threads of the REST server thread pool. Threads in the pool are reused to process REST requests. This controls the maximum number of requests processed concurrently. It may help to control the memory used by the REST server to avoid OOM issues. If the thread pool is full, incoming requests will be queued up and wait for some free threads. The default is 100.

property.name: wms.rest.threads.min
property.description: The minimum number of threads of the REST server thread pool. The thread pool always has at least these number of threads so the REST server is ready to serve incoming requests. The default is 2.

property.name: wms.rest.refresh.seconds
property.description: Time in seconds between refresh of the REST server page. Set to 0 to disable automatic refresh. The default is 5.

property.name: wms.job.timeout.min
property.description: The time in minutes that a workload duration is active before timing out. The default is 0 or no timeout.

property.name: wms.server.workload.cleaner.initial.delay
property.description: The period in seconds before the workload store cleaner begins cleaning.

property.name: wms.server.workload.cleaner.period
property.description: The period in seconds between each run of the workload store cleaner.

property.name: wms.server.cep.trafodion.keys
property.description: A comma separated list of Trafodion workload keys/types.
